verses.roman:
sei vibhinnāṁśa jīva--dui ta' prakāra
eka--'nitya-mukta', eka--'nitya-saṁsāra'

synonyms: sei vibhinna-aṁśa—that separated part and parcel of Kṛṣṇa; jīva—the living entity; dui ta' prakāra—two categories; eka—one; nitya-mukta—eternally liberated; eka—one; nitya-saṁsāra—perpetually conditioned.
translation: "The living entities [jīvas] are divided into two categories. Some are eternally liberated, and others are eternally conditioned.
